segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, completely unaware of the water overflowing onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just polishing that plate like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can someone be so oblivious to such a mess?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge, and she’s not reacting at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s even going to notice before the whole kitchen is flooded.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids behind her are up to something, but she’s too distracted to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like she’s in her own little world, completely detached from reality.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she looks while everything around her is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone needs to shake her out of this trance before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
